---

Anyone used the Dread Jenga tower mechanic with DW?  I&#39;d love your advice if you have. I&#39;m thinking I&#39;d use the tower as a countdown for &quot;things get *more&quot; Lovecraftian&quot; and do a pull any time anyone touches anything eldritch.<br /><a href="http://www.tiltingatwindmills.net/games/dread/" class="ot-anchor">http://www.tiltingatwindmills.net/games/dread/</a>


Attachment:

<a href='https://dreadthegame.wordpress.com/about-dread-the-game/'>About Dread the Game</a>


Dread is a game of horror and hope. Those who play will participate in a mutual telling of an original macabre tale. The goal of Dread is to sustain the delicate atmosphere that invokes the hand qu…
<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/100495092599585582455_photo.jpg'> Ray Otus</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-16 23:05:32 (edited: 2018-01-16 23:05:32)</cite></p>
        <p>It&#39;s an interesting thought. I would be careful about &quot;double-dipping&quot; though. It might work as a physical representation of grim portents. Whenever they roll a 6- you can, as the GM, make a hard move or ask them to pull a block from the tower and cite a portent of some kind. When the tower falls, the doom happens. Is that what you had in mind?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/100495092599585582455_photo.jpg'> Ray Otus</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-16 23:06:10 (edited: 2018-01-16 23:06:10)</cite></p>
        <p>If you wanted to accelerate it you could make them pull 1 on a 7-9 and succeed, or 2 on a 6- with failure.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-16 23:12:58 (edited: 2018-01-16 23:12:58)</cite></p>
        <p>I&#39;d like to see where this goes. I wanted to try this exactly with my home group, but none of them wanted to try. My feeling is do both on a 6-... Hard move and Pull. Otherwise as a GM I&#39;d be doing a little of both and (I think) the tower would take forever to fall... but I never go to try it!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103522231327065742687_photo.jpg'> Matthew G.</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-17 01:18:47 (edited: 2018-01-17 01:18:47)</cite></p>
        <p>In my campaign, the BBEG was ripping stars out of the night sky and tossing them to the ground. The players could pull bricks to avoid the associated cataclysmic dangers, one for one from a list of about a half dozen. They could choose to pull a number of bricks to avoid all dangers or leave some bricks and suffer the remaining dangers. For example: “Your essence is laid bare to the psychic eye of Manzaehoon; the GM takes 1 hold against you”<br /><br />If the Tower fell, it basically advanced a campaign front and brought the direct attention of the BBEG. If the Tower stood, it continued as-is until the next night...</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/106235978612484514517_photo.jpg'> J. Henning</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-17 19:59:59 (edited: 2018-01-17 19:59:59)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/103522231327065742687" oid="103522231327065742687">Matthew G.</a></span> nice, I like it. Thanks!<br /></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13kz15rfxmhe1kjr04chbipyybqjxhp41w'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/105691132767402178467_photo.jpg'> Tomer Gurantz</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-01-31 05:07:42 (edited: 2018-01-31 05:07:42)</cite></p>
        <p>Some players won&#39;t care, but one issue is players who feel like they&#39;ve worked towards a Dungeon World effective character who is now at the mercy of their clumsy fingers.<br /><br />I like the idea of some big grim portents comes to bear (instead of the character dying or getting into last breath), as <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/100495092599585582455" oid="100495092599585582455">Ray Otus</a></span> mentions above. <br /><br />That said, i experimented with this during a Dungeon World campaign a while back. Here&#39;s the details: <a href="http://www.supernovembergames.com/tomes-of-tomes/2015/9/25/dread-session-in-a-dungeon-world-campaign" data-embed="-_Zm9ybWF0PTEwMDB3mgEDODAwogEDMzQw-gsKMjAxNS0wOS0yNfoRZGh0dHA6Ly93d3cuc3VwZXJub3ZlbWJlcmdhbWVzLmNvbS90b21lcy1vZi10b21lcy8yMDE1LzkvMjUvZHJlYWQtc2Vzc2lvbi1pbi1hLWR1bmdlb24td29ybGQtY2FtcGFpZ24" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">http://www.supernovembergames.com/tomes-of-tomes/2015/9/25/dread-session-in-a-dungeon-world-campaign</a></p>
</div>
